overview: CodeQL 2.24.1 expands language and framework support — including Kotlin up to 2.3.0, Struts 7.x, Maven private registries as plugin repositories, C23/C++26 #embed, C# 14 null-conditional assignments, and new Python taint sources for agents/openai/websockets — while improving query accuracy with reduced false positives and adding an experimental Python prompt injection query.

detailed_explanation.title: Language and framework support additions
bullets: Kotlin support extended up to version 2.3.0; versions 1.6.x and 1.7.x are dropped.
Maven private registries can now also serve as plugin repositories for Default Setup.
Python ListElement path and taint tracking added for agents and openai modules.
Python websockets remote flow sources added.

detailed_explanation.title: Query changes and improvements
bullets: C/C++ GuardCondition bug fix improves accuracy of conditional checks.
Improved buffer size accuracy reduces false positives across 6 buffer overflow queries.
Java java/unreleased-lock query improved for better detection.
New experimental Python query py/prompt-injection for detecting LLM prompt injection vulnerabilities.
GitHub Actions crash fix for long ${{ }} expressions.

detailed_explanation.title: Deployment
bullets: Will be included in a future GitHub Enterprise Server (GHES) release.

key_changes: Kotlin support extended to 2.3.0; versions 1.6.x and 1.7.x dropped.
Struts 7.x support and Maven private registry plugin repository support for Default Setup.
C23/C++26 #embed and C# 14 null-conditional assignment support.
Python taint tracking for agents/openai modules and websockets remote flow sources.
Reduced false positives in 6 C/C++ buffer overflow queries via improved buffer size accuracy.
New experimental py/prompt-injection query for LLM prompt injection detection.
GitHub Actions crash fix for long ${{ }} expressions.
impact: Teams using Kotlin 2.x get updated analysis up to 2.3.0; those on 1.6.x/1.7.x must upgrade.
Java projects using Maven private registries benefit from Default Setup compatibility for plugin resolution.
Python developers building AI/LLM applications gain taint tracking for openai/agents modules and a new prompt injection detection query.
C/C++ codebases will see fewer false positive buffer overflow alerts.
GitHub.com users receive these improvements automatically; GHES users must wait for a future release.
caveats: Kotlin 1.6.x and 1.7.x are no longer supported; projects on these versions must upgrade.
The py/prompt-injection query is experimental and may produce false positives or miss some patterns.
GHES users do not receive these changes until a future GHES release.
The specific GHES release version for these changes is not stated in the article.
insights: The new py/prompt-injection query signals GitHub’s recognition of LLM prompt injection as a supply-chain-level security concern worth detecting statically.
Adding taint tracking for the openai and agents Python modules shows CodeQL is actively following the AI-agent development ecosystem.
Dropping Kotlin 1.6.x/1.7.x while adding 2.3.0 support indicates CodeQL is prioritizing modern language versions and reducing maintenance burden for legacy versions.
